text.p: Comprehensive Environmental Systems Inc said on Tuesday that Nasdaq declined to reinstate it on the Nasdaq listing, but encouraged the company to apply again.

Nasdaq's qualifications panel noted with approval that Comprehensive had terminated former officers who were indicted for violations of federal securities laws. The company was encouraged to apply again for reinstatement on Nasdaq's small caps listing after filing its 10K with audited financial statements for the year ending April 30.
Comprehensive,through its Trade-Winds Environmental Restoration Inc subsidiary, offers services in the areas of hazardous-waste removal, asbestos removal, lead clean-up and emergency spill response.
